title: Sans serif, Bold, Extended
content:
Does anyone recognise this? I found it on an old bookcover (Germany, 1960). Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024005506im_/http:/typophile.com/files/type002_5194.jpg)
author: Iznik

comments.content: some form of Helvetica? Except the t doesn't work for that....

I think the closest you could get to this is the typeface DN Grotesk which Pangea design did for a swedish newspaper. The black weight of this typeface is especially similar to your sample.  
Not so much here, but still a small overview:  
 [http://pangeadesign.se/index.php?option=com\_content&view=article&id=23%3...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024005506/http:/pangeadesign.se/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=23%3Adagens-nyheter&catid=2%3Akunduppdrag&Itemid=14&lang=en "http://pangeadesign.se/index.php?option=com\_content&view=article&id=23%3Adagens-nyheter&catid=2%3Akunduppdrag&Itemid=14&lang=en")

hmm I don't see too much of a resemblance there. Helvetica would be closer. Guess it's one these old fonts that got lost in the digital aera.

Thanks anyway.
